meanings.definition: Extending or moving in one direction without curving or bending.
meanings.sent1: The ruler is straight and perfect for drawing lines.
meanings.sent2: She has straight hair that falls smoothly down her back.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to walk straight with a wobbly tail, looking quite funny.
meanings.sent4: His serious face and straight posture made him seem like a strict teacher.
meanings.sent5: The road ahead was so straight, it seemed to go on forever.

meanings.definition: Not crooked or bent; having a constant direction.
meanings.sent1: The path through the forest was straight and easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: He always tells the truth and keeps a straight path in life.
meanings.sent3: The tree grew so straight and tall, it looked like a giant pencil.
meanings.sent4: Her honesty was like a straight arrow, always hitting the mark.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed in a straight line, never deviating from its course.

meanings.sent1: She went straight to the store to buy some milk.
meanings.sent2: He looked straight into her eyes and apologized sincerely.
meanings.sent3: The dog ran straight to the door, eager to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The arrow flew straight through the air, hitting the target perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The sun shone straight down on the field, warming everything below.
